job_title: Pharmacist in Holly Hill, FL
pros: Good leadership, focused on patient care and our community, fair compensation, ethical health care plan
cons: Small company limited room for promotion

job_title: Mid-level Provider in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Good benefits, close to home.
cons: No pay raises, family doctors don't see their sick patients. Support staff and middle management with poor work ethic. Chronically short staffed. Pass the buck attitude.

review_title: Great place for fast paced phones. then lots of downtime.
job_title: Call Center Coordinator in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: people were great. pay good. hours were good
cons: my poor supervisor was worked to death, even putting her own health at risk. We begged her to report being taken advantage of, to the administration but she would not for fear of loosing her job, She was training 4 employees at 1 time. I felt so bad for her.

job_title: Claims Examiner in Holly Hill, FL
pros: flexible good hours to work
cons: Not all management in all areas of the company are qualified.

job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Good place to work. Good benefits.
cons: Pay isn't great, below average.

job_title: MCSS in Sanford, FL
pros: Great pay and hours. Care about their employees and have fun with special lunches or themed days. The work is busy but makes the day go fast and it's not stressful. Benefits are excellent as well. Can do this for a career or a stepping stone to something better.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Physician Office Medical Coder in Port Orange, FL
pros: Good benefits and friendly coworkers.
cons: Managers in the department often show favoritism and often don’t give the same opportunities to all employees.

job_title: Coordinator in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Free health insurance, met some really great people.
cons: Free health insurance was great but the plans they offered were so expensive to use its own employees delayed/put off necessary care. Completely not worth it as they also grossly underpay. Pay increases a few cents a year or capped. 3 unscheduled days a year is unrealistic. Management was becoming less friendly,  more interested in the bottom line. Didn't know how to give kudos to employees at all. HR was a huge part of the problem!

job_title: Registered Nurse in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Great PTO, bonuses, and raises.
cons: Sometimes it can take some time to make change.

job_title: Physician Assistant in Volusia, FL
pros: Fair work load usually but much worse since the COVID-19
cons: 1% raise after 3 to 4 years, family physicians dont seem to want to see their sick respiratory patients after the COVID-19 pandemic and "dumped" their patients on the urgent care side, bad clinic management, difficulty retaining trained employees

job_title: Pharmacist in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Local, caring, experienced leadership, culture of excellence
cons: None, small company which is not a con

review_title: Too much work, not enough money.
job_title: Medical Coder in Holly Hill, FL
pros: They offer great benefits for employees.
cons: They continue adding to your workload without raises or incentive.

review_title: Lousy place to work, no direction, no vision, no knowledge and no skills in most departments.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Holly Hill, FL
pros: Some of the staff there are good people and some doctors are real good. There are so many problems that you will never get bored or have nothing to do (just don't expect anything to change). Insurance itself is not too bad.
cons: Infrastructure is terrible. Resources (people and their technology,skills, knowledge) are sorely lacking. Time off and pay are pathetic. Management exists in a dream like fog thinking they pay good for the area all the while using the logic that the organization is not in a metropolitan area. They want to draw people from those areas, but don't believe they have to pay for them. There is no path for growth or advancement. If you want to expand your skills or knowledge, do it yourself. No need for training or expansion has been stated by relatively high level managers. Individuals exist in positions they are clearly not qualified for, cannot perform in and are part of the reason Florida Health Care has the problems they have yet they keep them around. Unless you are a friend of a friend or a family member, then you are nothing inside the company. The dress code is stupid.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Daytona Branch, MI
pros: Salaries are adequate for the job
cons: Too many changes in operation

review_title: Great company, but not the most competitive pay
job_title: Medical Customer Service Specialist II in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Free health insurance, flexible schedule, and work life balance
cons: Not the most competitive pay rate out there

job_title: Medical Billing/Collections in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Free Healthcare to all employees.
cons: Not updated software or too much software to work from.

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: great benefits and room to grow
cons: Only allowed 3 unscheduled absences

review_title: Uneducated supervisors and managers with minimal leadership skills
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Volusia, FL
pros: Health benefits can be free if your are not overweight and don't smoke.
cons: Problem solving skills are minimal within mid management up. Specific issues and concerns brought through the chain of command are left unaddressed even though it can effect patient care. If you elect benefits be careful as you may not be able to use them. It seemed more a problem with the vendors the company uses rather than Florida Health Care itself.

job_title: MCSS II in Holly Hill, FL
pros: Everything is great at this company! Free health insurance, free gym memberships, PTO, and much more! Fellow employees are pleasant too!
cons: The member services department really makes it difficult to help patients. I dreaded calling them.

job_title: Construction Apprentice in Holly Hill, FL
pros: Apprentice - given the chance to be trained, however not so sure this is a pro because in my opinion management's direction is pathetic
cons: In my opinion my boss in the construction department provides lousy direction and is uncaring because I am overworked and underpaid. I ask for help and my boss never asks other employees in my department to help me, while the boss who in my opinion has an "outdated mindset  that is not current with the times" just walks around doing nothing. I feel that this company has pathetic pay, and an extremely low salary cap for all of the work they make us do.  Our department has low quality standards compared to other companies I have worked for but I think this is because we have poor direction from management.  I have been looking for a company with better management that knows what they are doing.

review_title: Do yourself a huge favor - stay far, far away from here!!
job_title: IT Manager in Holly Hill, FL
pros: Not many, at one time the cheaper insurance was a plus but not anymore they did away with most if not all of the employee perks over the years.
cons: Pay is not competitive nor are the benefits. Politics, in-fighting, and nepotism rule the roost here. The technology is ancient and many folks are riding it out till retirement and are, well, less than motivated to do or try new (new 15 years ago) things. If you work here you will think you have entered a time machine.

job_title: Radiology Information Systems Management in Holly Hill, FL
pros: None. Do not work for this organization. You will be shocked by the nepotism, chaos and magnitude of incompetent upper management
cons: Too many to list. I have worked for numerous companies over my 40 year career, and have never once been terminated or placed on performance plans. However, this company takes the academy award in the category of 'purgatory,'  I have never worked in an environment with the magnitude of nepotism,  incompetent, chaotic and dysfunctionality management demonstrates, on a daily basis, in this organization. Human Resources is inundated with complaints against management, but does nothing.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY.

review_title: Horrible place to work, stay away if you value your career
job_title: MCSS in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Many locations to work because everyone quits after  a year or so.
cons: Managent hires Family and plays favorites. The Billing Supervisors and Office Managers make assumptions and act on them without verifying anything - you will be blindsighted with writeups based on non-facts and opinions only. The Higher ups don't care if the managers are running amok and the lower employees on the totem pole cant do anything a them, which is why everyone quits.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Holly Hill, FL
pros: It paid the bills (kinda) & was full-time. Health benefits for the employee.
cons: Management is completely lacking. It appeared as if the manager in the department I was working in simply rode the coat tails of her manager to get to her position. It's a "who you know" type of place. Communication is horrible, or actually non-existent and the atmosphere is incredibly cliqueish.

review_title: Hectic and stressful to say the least . It’s a dog eat dog work atmosphere.
job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Orange City, FL
pros: Insurance ,a steady income along with a few good hard working people picking up the slack for the rest.
cons: Managers who are too comfortable and set in their ways along with staff who know how to work the system and preferential treatment .

job_title: MCSS in Volusia, FL
pros: Free healthcare, paid time off, 401k and annual bonus. Fantastic doctors. I feel that the leaders of the company do care for their employees and their members.
cons: Management does not hold employees accountable for repetitive errors/carelessness. Extreme amount of favoritism. Lack of communication from practice manager.

job_title: IT Guy in Holly Hill, FL
pros: It's an interesting gig for newcomers!
cons: Inadequate IT systems infrastructure, lack of communication and management fully unintelligible of current IT trends. Heavily relies on dispensable IT contractors in favor of a good old boy hierarchal system.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Holly Hill, FL
pros: The people of Florida Health Care Plans are caring and many are very hard working.  The are some in management who need to be more forward thinking rather than relying on the status quo.
cons: Many of the more tenured employees are reluctant to learn new things.

job_title: Office Assistant in Holly Hill, FL
pros: Positive work environment, great benefits, leadership is very encouraging and open to input.
cons: No set training..I think I would be beneficial is a training guide was maintained and set up not only for new employees but for current employees as well that might need a refresher. Rules constantly being made as higher ups go.

job_title: Manager in Holly Hill, FL
pros:
Compassionate management
Understanding when it comes to life necessities and emergencies
Sensitive to employee family requirements
Great place to encourage wellness and fitness
cons: Except for the location which is great for the locals, can't think of any
